text:
Q: Hangfire DistributedLockTimeoutException when calling the same static method concurrently A:

Your jobs are trying to acquire an exclusive lock (like trying to enter a room when only one person can be inside at a time), but they're all timing out because the first job is holding that lock for too long.

Hangfire is applying a DisableConcurrentExecution attribute to your DownloadImage method, which creates a distributed lock. This prevents multiple instances of the same method from running simultaneously. The first job acquires the lock and starts downloading, while all the other jobs wait in line. However, they don't wait long enough—they timeout trying to get the lock, fail, retry immediately, timeout again, and burn through all 5 retry attempts in under a second.

Root cause is here:
at Hangfire.DisableConcurrentExecutionAttribute.OnPerforming(PerformingContext filterContext)

Find and remove any [DisableConcurrentExecution] attribute applied to your DownloadImage method or its containing class. Since you're downloading different images (different URLs), there's no reason these jobs can't run concurrently, or Increase the Timeout (which i don't recommend).

Q: How to disable tab switching animation and remove “liquid” background effect in UITabBarController (iOS 26) A:

You can completely disable the glass effect throughout the app.

Add UIDesignRequiresCompatibility flag in info.plist Boolean YES

This will disable the Liquid Glass API on ios 26

Q: How to solve Permission denied (publickey) error when using Git? A:

For Windows, the OpenSSH Service may not be running

For some reason, the OpenSSH Agent was set to Manual start, so it wasn't running. To start it:

  1. Enter services in the bottom search bar and press enter

  2. Find OpenSSH Authentication Agent, check it's status

  3. If it's not running, right click and start it

  4. Optionally, right click and select properties and set the startup type to Automatic.

As soon as it was running, I also had to run start-ssh-agent.cmd in the git-for-windows\cmd directory, but after that, no problem with authenticating.

Q: error: cannot update the ref 'refs/remotes/origin/xyz': unable to create directory for '.git/logs/refs/remotes/origin/xyz': No such file or directory A:

For me, deleting both the log directory and ref directory fixed it.

.git\logs\refs\remotes\

.git\refs\remotes\
